page.title: 10RELIGION - THE CHURCH contd.
page.content: The Barnard family gave the vestry, stained glass window and the tower clock. They also built a tunnel from the castle to the church for the family and their servants to go to Sunday prayers. On two of the pillars in the nave are the letters RW and WW. They stand for Richard Washington and William Washington. They were thought to be ancestors of George Washington, the first President of America. The altar table was given by Dr. Storrs Fox and his brothers in memory of their parents. In York Minster there is a silver cup from our church, it has the Hull hallmark and is dated 1640. In 1850 the church got an organ.In the tower there are three bells made by Sellers of York.
